section.heading: Art dealer and artist; relationship.
section.text: If an art dealer accepts a work of fine art, on a fee, commission, or other compensation basis, on consignment from the artist who created the work of fine art:

para.text: The art dealer shall be, with respect to that work of fine art, the agent of the artist;
The work of fine art shall be trust property and the art dealer shall be a trustee for the benefit of the artist until the work of fine art shall be sold to a bona fide third party; and
The proceeds of the sale of the work of fine art shall be trust property and the art dealer shall be a trustee for the benefit of the artist until the amount due to the artist from the sale is paid.

annotations.annotation: This section is referenced in § 28-5103 and § 28-5104.
